title: "we nerfed orange esssence because you'd be getting more skin shards"
body:
So far i havent seen those "more skin shards" in boxes, 0 skin shards from leveling up too.

So it was basically just a nerf to OE with a fake excuse, typical riot, just like when they said "nobody wants solo q flex is much better" and we had to put with that garbage for a full year.

replies.body:
I'm not sure where OP pulled this quote from. And we need the community's help to correct things like this:

> So far i havent seen those "more skin shards" in boxes, 0 skin shards from leveling up too.

Skin shards from leveling up? That's not a thing. 

It's really harmful to upvote misinformation like this. To really understand about the orange essence nerfs, [here's a really detailed post about the orange essence nerfs](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/fRZopjhE-bring-back-the-old-value-of-orange-disenchant-riot?comment=0009) I made a while back on these boards. 

Please let us know how you feel about the explanation given there—I promise I'll pass on your feedback to the devs. Just do me a favor and make sure you read the post so your feedback is based on what we actually said about it!

There have definitely been posts from Rioters implying that the OE nerfs were from an idea to redistribute player rewards from the hextech chests to other parts of the game (missions, events, etc.) yet it felt like the Overcharge event gave players much less in rewards than previous events (if you wanted the exclusive icon you wouldn't be able to afford any orbs at all)

I'll try to find the red posts later, not really in the mood to sift back a week in the red tracker at the moment.

> There have definitely been posts from Rioters implying that the OE nerfs were from an idea to redistribute player rewards from the hextech chests to other parts of the game (missions, events, etc.)

Yeah I say that exactly in the post I linked. But there's more to it than that. This is why I really want folks to read the post before commenting with feedback. 

I'm curious about your thoughts on the Overcharge missions. How many of the missions did you do?

All of them. I personally liked them because they were pretty straightforward and didn't pull none of the "5 man premade" shenanigans of other missions and none of the missions or rewards were tied to a pass you'd have to buy with RP.

I can see the few people that primarily don't play games on Summoner's Rift having an issue with the "win a game on **Summoner's Rift** in under 33 minutes" mission though.
How much stuff were you able to get with the tokens you unlocked? I'm not actually aware of how much it totaled out to

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Cactopus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5vUJflhE,comment-id=001e0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-12-05T20:53:36.057+0000)
>
> How much stuff were you able to get with the tokens you unlocked? I'm not actually aware of how much it totaled out to

2 Orbs for completing the entire event. Could have been as low as 300 essence after disenchanting, maybe double that if you were lucky, more if you were REALLY lucky. And OP is not spreading misinformation, you do not get skin shards from leveling up. They didn't say you promised that. They are correctly stating we do not have any substantial additional sources of skin shards yet, but our shards are worth less AND cost more to upgrade.
I got super lucky with my orbs, got around 5k OE worth of shards from the two orbs

I got 100 OE flat + around 300 OE if I disenchanted the skins from my two orbs.  That's the problem with lootboxes, same work put in, yet Player A gets 5000 and Player B gets 500 (Or less apparently).  That's just why I don't think Riot should ever use RNG to justify anything with regards to loot from events.

Every mission completed got me a Project Zed skin shard which I don't need, 2 key fragments, and 160 BE. Going from level 30 to 45 I now have the Zed shard worth 270, a 104 skin shard, and a ward skin worth 128. 15 levels, an honor capsule, and an event full clear for a total of 502 OE. That's not even halfway to an epic skin. 

The problem is that you guys have continued to be disingenuous throughout this entire process. You use 'best case' hypotheticals for every change. I own every champion, the BE gains are absolute shit, but even if they were better I still wouldn't have anything to spend it on. You revamped the entire BE system to just give us back a system with the same problems but with less reward. Gain a level, get depressed when I think about opening my level capsule, open the level capsule, grind down the garbage into BE, have nothing to spend BE on. You guys didn't 'fix' shit.

With OE, you just nerfed the shit out of it and tried to be disingenuous again, but the change is so bad and obvious that you couldn't fool a 2 year old. I play multiple games every single day, and if I continue at this rate, I'll be able to unlock my first Legendary skin by October 2018. With the BE, you could at least fool the dumb dumbs into thinking that they got a sweet deal, but the OE change is so laughably fucking horrible that even your apologists are staying away from this one. You can't even use monkey math or fool anyone with misdirection when you go that blatant and over the top.

Because they want us to purchase more. They figure the less we receive the more we will purchase. And they straight up lie about it, or cleverly word or reword things to disguise their intentions.

Riot only cares about the $$$

Sadly for them, they'll never win that war with me. About a year ago I decided to not spend a single penny here again until we get a permanent or monthly rotation of URF/One For All/Hexakill. I hate that the modes I'd rather be playing are locked in a vault somewhere, and we are forced to play LC$ Simulator like good monkeys. Them being greedy on top of that just makes me feel better about my decision.

I have also refused to purchase any RP since they increased the prices in Europe in 2015. To make me purchase RP again (even at the higher rates), they would need to do away with all these demonstrations of superior greed.

I hope this kind of boycotting—for whatever reason—is widespread.

I'm just a broke hoe, and I refuse to pay for something I can earn in game. Or at least something I used to be able to earn in game.

The only thing I pay for is skins, and I think maybe I bought one of those champion starter bundles when I first made an account or two.
If you want the borders, you end up with the borders and 16 tokens, which is worth next to nothing.

I think Riot is going through a weird period, trying to figure out just how much those Borders are worth to people. The SG skins, it came with a bundle with an icon. Here, ya unlock it for *all* the new Project Skins, regardless of when you buy them.

I believe the OP refers to this from the quite you linked. Actually I also left with the impression we'd get more shards. I wouldn't argue if it is a god change or not, though maybe it would be a good idea to give us some sort of schedule on these events, when they will happen and the approximate value we would get from them.

Edit: Brought the whole paragraph.

Yeah it's true that you get skin shards from events like Overcharge now. But that's a lot different than what OP is saying. Here's what OP said:

> So far i havent seen those "more skin shards" in boxes, 0 skin shards from leveling up too.

I mean, help me out, guys. All of you know for a fact by now that we never said you'd get skin shards from leveling up. That's not what the system is for. And we also didn't change the rate that skin shards drop in boxes (we never said we would). You guys on the boards are some of the most engaged players who read everything we put out—I really need community members to call out stuff that's just straight up misinformation like this.

> I mean, help me out, guys. All of you know for a fact by now that we never said you'd get skin shards from leveling up. That's not what the system is for.

Yes, his point probably was that the leveling up system does not contribute to it in any way, while it could have as it was coincidentally released with the changes, he listed it just so that someone doesn't go "Maybe we'll get some OE from the leveling up evetually". It's one short subsentence you focus too much on and call it disinformation, when he says he didn't get any skin shards from boxes either, which is much more crucial problem you ignore. That RNG that somehow gives ya'll hard-on. The fact someone may not mind your change because they get legendary from every box while someone else is fucked over because they got champ shard, again. And the fact champ shard can drop is still gambling problem with bought chests despite the bad luck protection.

People would bitch less if there wasn't RNG in nearly every reward now. I got the minimum 810 BE from either majority or quite a lot of my leveling up capsules. It makes me ignore your statistics on how small chance that it and makes me just think the system sucks, since someone might've gotten even less essence than me or double the essence than me despite the fact we put in the same performance to level up. Boxes the same thing. Majority of my boxes this year, which were defo more than 10, had champ shards... So like... Thanks I guess but I don't understand why my S+ grade was worth less than someone else.

This creates the reason people hate the leveling capsules. Because some people don't want to wait out 30 level-ups to make sure majority of their capsules won't be the 810 BE and that big fancy maximum bumber is there just to pretend the system is more rewarding. And because some people don't have enough luck to grind 1000 legendaries to be able to redeem that one legendary. Seriously I think the ratio is currently cca 4 or 3 disenchanted legendaries to redeem one legendary. That's a lot of luck one needs to unlock something so all that one can do is that Skin Shards as nice decorations in inventory and ignore them due to the new OE ratio.

This entire season seems like I will have to quite ignore the honor system, the level-up system, the lootbox system and the mastery system because neither gives guarantee of reward for the performance given good enough for me to care. If that protects your revenue okay, but now when I get skin shard I know it's very likely going to eat dust in inventory, when I get capsule I am ready for another measly 810 BE, when I get Mastery token I know it's waste to redeem it when I get Honor Capsule it's going to shit out some low-value shard and 30th key for me.

The skin shards thing may yet to change based on how bad luck protection will work for me when the lootbox-per-season resets, in case Overcharge wasn't example of the "more OE from events" maybe I'll grind some from future events over year, but the rest makes me feel very... uninterested. With honor I don't care much, the system is kinda broken, I am not honorful enough for that high tier and one should not be honorful for rewards, but the Mastery prices, which are staying the same for way too long and the frequency of the minimum value capsules hurts.
